intro: Linderniella wilmsii, commonly known as the Wilms' lindernia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Lamiaceae. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple, arranged in dense clusters. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy to the touch. Linderniella wilmsii is adapted to arid environments and is often found in open woodlands or along streambanks.
